description: In this course William Lasseter analyzes and explains Mary Shelley’s classic 1818 novel “Frankenstein; or, the Modern Prometheus”. Mary Shelley's work follows the story of a man who uncovers the secret of life and must face the catastrophic consequences for his Promethean audacity. Nearly 200 years after being penned, “Frankenstein” remains one of the most enduring stories in fictional horror.
title: Breaking Down Frankenstein
